injectables.name: DashboardService

properties.name: apiUrl
properties.description: Base API URL for all HTTP requests
properties.rawdescription: Base API URL for all HTTP requests

methods.name: deleteJob
methods.description:
Deletes a specific job from the backend.

Example :
```typescript
this.dashboardService.deleteJob('job-123').subscribe({
  next: () => console.log('Job deleted successfully'),
  error: (error) => console.error('Failed to delete job:', error)
});
Example :

jsdoctags.comment: • Unique identifier of the job to delete
Observable - An observable that completes when the job is deleted

Example :
this.dashboardService.deleteJob('job-123').subscribe({
  next: () => console.log('Job deleted successfully'),
  error: (error) => console.error('Failed to delete job:', error)
});

methods.name: generateActivitiesFromJobs
methods.rawdescription:
Generates mock recent activities from job data.
Creates activity entries based on job status and creation dates.


This method processes the most recent 3 jobs and creates activities for:
- Job creation (for all jobs)
- Job completion (for completed jobs with simulated completion time)
- Job progress (for in-progress jobs with simulated start time)

The activities are sorted by timestamp in descending order and limited to 10 items.
methods.description:
Generates mock recent activities from job data. Creates activity entries based on job status and creation dates.

This method processes the most recent 3 jobs and creates activities for:

  • Job creation (for all jobs)
  • Job completion (for completed jobs with simulated completion time)
  • Job progress (for in-progress jobs with simulated start time)

The activities are sorted by timestamp in descending order and limited to 10 items.

jsdoctags.comment: • Array of jobs to generate activities from
RecentActivity[] - Array of generated activities, sorted by timestamp (max 10 items)

methods.name: getJobs
methods.description:
Retrieves all jobs from the backend API.

Example :
```typescript
this.dashboardService.getJobs().subscribe(jobs => {
  console.log('Loaded jobs:', jobs);
});
Example :

jsdoctags.comment: Observable<Job[]> - An observable containing an array of all jobs

methods.name: getRecentActivities
methods.description:
Generates and retrieves recent activities based on job data. Creates activity entries for job creation, completion, and progress updates.

Example :
```typescript
this.dashboardService.getRecentActivities().subscribe(activities => {
  console.log('Recent activities:', activities);
});
Example :

jsdoctags.comment: Observable<RecentActivity[]> - An observable containing recent activities (max 10 items)

methods.name: updateJobStatus
methods.description:
Updates the status of a specific job.

Example :
```typescript
this.dashboardService.updateJobStatus('job-123', 'completed').subscribe({
  next: (updatedJob) => console.log('Job updated:', updatedJob),
  error: (error) => console.error('Failed to update job:', error)
});
Example :

jsdoctags.comment: • Unique identifier of the job to update
• New status to assign to the job ('pending' | 'inProgress' | 'completed')
Observable - An observable containing the updated job object

Example :
this.dashboardService.updateJobStatus('job-123', 'completed').subscribe({
  next: (updatedJob) => console.log('Job updated:', updatedJob),
  error: (error) => console.error('Failed to update job:', error)
});

components.name: JobCardComponent

inputsClass.name: job
inputsClass.rawdescription:
Job data to be displayed in the card.
Required input property containing all job information.
inputsClass.description: Job data to be displayed in the card. Required input property containing all job information.

outputsClass.name: viewDetails
outputsClass.rawdescription:
Event emitter for when user wants to view job details.
Emits the complete job object to parent component.
outputsClass.description: Event emitter for when user wants to view job details. Emits the complete job object to parent component.

methodsClass.name: getStatusClass
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Returns the appropriate CSS class name for styling based on job status.
Used for applying status-specific styling to card elements.


```html
```typescript
const cssClass = this.getStatusClass('inProgress'); // returns 'in-progress'
```
```
CSS class mapping:
- 'completed'  'completed' (green styling)
- 'pending'  'pending' (orange styling)
- 'inProgress'  'in-progress' (purple styling)
- default  '' (no specific styling)
methodsClass.description:
Returns the appropriate CSS class name for styling based on job status. Used for applying status-specific styling to card elements.

Example :
```typescript
const cssClass = this.getStatusClass('inProgress'); // returns 'in-progress'
Example :
CSS class mapping:
- 'completed'  'completed' (green styling)
- 'pending'  'pending' (orange styling)
- 'inProgress'  'in-progress' (purple styling)
- default  '' (no specific styling)

jsdoctags.comment: • The job status to get CSS class for

methodsClass.name: getStatusColor
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Returns the appropriate Angular Material color theme for a given job status.
Used for styling status chips and indicators with consistent color coding.


```html
```typescript
const color = this.getStatusColor('completed'); // returns 'primary'
```
```
Color mapping:
- 'completed'  'primary' (blue/green theme)
- 'pending'  'warn' (orange/amber theme)
- 'inProgress'  'accent' (purple/pink theme)
- default  '' (no theme applied)
methodsClass.description:
Returns the appropriate Angular Material color theme for a given job status. Used for styling status chips and indicators with consistent color coding.

- 'inProgress'  'accent' (purple/pink theme)

jsdoctags.comment: • The job status to get color for

methodsClass.name: getStatusIcon
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Returns the appropriate Material Design icon name for a given job status.
Provides visual representation of job state using recognizable icons.


```html
```typescript
const icon = this.getStatusIcon('pending'); // returns 'schedule'
```
```
Icon mapping:
- 'completed'  'check_circle' (checkmark in circle)
- 'pending'  'schedule' (clock icon)
- 'inProgress'  'hourglass_empty' (hourglass icon)
- default  'info' (information icon)

methodsClass.name: onViewDetails
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Handles the view details button click event.
Emits the current job object to parent component for detailed view.


```html
```html
<button (click)="onViewDetails()">View Details</button>
```
```
This method is typically called when user clicks on "View Details" button
or the card itself. It emits the complete job object through the viewDetails
EventEmitter, allowing parent components to open detailed job information
in a sidebar, modal, or separate view.

in a sidebar, modal, or separate view.

inputsClass.rawdescription:
Controls the visibility state of the sidebar.
When true, sidebar slides in from the left.

inputsClass.rawdescription:
The job object to display detailed information for.
When null, sidebar shows empty state.

methodsClass.name: onDeleteJob
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Handles job deletion with user confirmation.
Shows confirmation dialog and deletes job if confirmed.
Emits jobDeleted event and closes sidebar on success.


```html
```html
<button mat-raised-button color="warn" (click)="onDeleteJob()">
  Delete Job
</button>
```
```
Process:
1. Validates selectedJob exists
2. Shows native confirmation dialog
3. Calls dashboard service to delete job
4. On success: emits jobDeleted with job ID and closes sidebar
5. On error: shows error alert to user
methodsClass.description:
Handles job deletion with user confirmation. Shows confirmation dialog and deletes job if confirmed. Emits jobDeleted event and closes sidebar on success.

Example :
```html

  Delete Job
</button>
Example :
Process:
1. Validates selectedJob exists
2. Shows native confirmation dialog
3. Calls dashboard service to delete job
4. On success: emits jobDeleted with job ID and closes sidebar
5. On error: shows error alert to user

methodsClass.rawdescription:
Handles clicks on the sidebar overlay background. Closes the sidebar when user clicks outside the sidebar content. ```html ```html
``` ```
methodsClass.description:
Handles clicks on the sidebar overlay background. Closes the sidebar when user clicks outside the sidebar content.

Example :
```html
<div class="overlay" (click)="onOverlayClick()"></div>
Example :

methodsClass.name: onStatusChange
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Handles job status updates from the status dropdown.
Updates job status via API and emits updated job to parent.


```html
```html
<mat-select (selectionChange)="onStatusChange($event.value)">
  <mat-option value="pending">Pending</mat-option>
</mat-select>
```
```
Process:
1. Validates selectedJob exists and status is different
2. Calls dashboard service to update job status
3. On success: updates local job object and emits jobStatusUpdated
4. On error: shows error alert to user
methodsClass.description:
Handles job status updates from the status dropdown. Updates job status via API and emits updated job to parent.

Example :
```html
<mat-select (selectionChange)="onStatusChange($event.value)">
  <mat-option value="pending">Pending</mat-option>
</mat-select>
Example :
Process:
1. Validates selectedJob exists and status is different
2. Calls dashboard service to update job status
3. On success: updates local job object and emits jobStatusUpdated
4. On error: shows error alert to user

jsdoctags.comment: • The new status to assign to the job
